parts.text: {"language": "English", "text": "[Visual: SpeakerA and SpeakerB, in a split screen, discuss the achievement of a dream physique and the associated feelings.] [Visual: Two people are seen in a split screen, each speaking into a microphone.] [Visual: A woman, with a podcast logo visible, shares her experience of being skinny and insecure, inspired by others' physiques.] : You basically reached your dream physique. [Visual: A muscular man, shirtless in a gym, shares his obsession with achieving his dream physique, feeling it was the only path.] : Does it feel good when you finally hit your goal? [Visual: A man in a gym expresses the satisfaction of reaching and nailing his physique goals.] [Visual: A woman is speaking into a microphone with a podcast logo visible.] : I was super skinny, insecure, looked up certain people that had certain physiques. [Visual: A muscular man poses shirtless in a gym.] : I was just so obsessed with it that I literally felt like I had no other option, that was the only path forward. [Visual: A man is performing a deadlift in a gym.] : Hit a point where I wanted to get to and nailed it.", "max_char": 150}

{"language": "English", "text": "[Visual: A man asks, \"What's your type?\" while the text on the screen reads 'what's your type?'.] [Visual: A man is speaking into a microphone while the words 'what's your type?' are displayed on the screen.] [Visual: A man says his type is someone with a good heart while the text on the screen reads 'a good heart'.] : What's your type? [Visual: A woman states that the person will have to leave Los Angeles while the text on the screen reads 'leave Los Angeles'.] : Somebody who has a good heart. [Visual: A man suggests they create a list of suitors and have them duel while the text on the screen reads 'make them duel'.] [Visual: A woman is speaking into a microphone while the words 'a good heart' are displayed on the screen.] [Visual: A person on horseback participates in a joust, while the text on the screen reads 'make them duel'.] : You're gonna have to leave Los Angeles. [Visual: A man asks if a duel is like a chess tournament while the text on the screen reads 'a chess tournament?'.] [Visual: A man is speaking into a microphone while the words 'leave Los Angeles' are displayed on the screen.] [Visual: A man clarifies that a duel can be any type.] : We're gonna make her a list of suitors, and then we're gonna make them duel. [Visual: A woman reveals she wants them to fight physically while the text on the screen reads 'of duel to fight physically'.] [Visual: A person on horseback, wearing armor, jousts, while the words 'make them duel' are displayed on the screen.] [Visual: A woman mentions she was considering swordsmanship or fencing, but she wants a 'manlier man' while the words 'A manlier man' are displayed, with a fencer in action.] : Is a duel a chess tournament? [Visual: A man is speaking into a microphone while the words 'a chess tournament?' are displayed on the screen.] : No, it could be any type of duel. : She wanted them to fight physically. [Visual: A woman is speaking into a microphone while the words 'of duel to fight physically' are displayed on the screen.] : I was thinking swordsmanship, fencing- I could use a manlier man than a fencer, guys. [Visual: The scene is split between a woman speaking into a microphone and a fencer in action, while the words 'A manlier man' are displayed.]", "max_char": 150}

{"language": "English", "text": "[Visual: Speaker describes the personality on the David Alvarez Show as a \"nerdy womanizer\", prompting surprise and a reaction.] : Because your personality on the David Alvarez Show for me is like nerdy womanizer. [Visual: A woman with long brown hair sits in an orange chair in front of a microphone, talking.] : Whoa. [Visual: A man in a white shirt sits in front of a microphone and talks, looking to the side.] : Is that wrong? [Visual: The speakers react to the description, with one clarifying they were thinking of \"nerdy fuckboy\", and discussing the synonyms of the words.] : Those are just 2 words I've never heard together. [Visual: A man is sitting in front of a microphone, talking.] : Yeah, I've never heard nerdy and womanizer. [Visual: A vertically split screen shows a woman at the top, and a man and a woman at the bottom, all sitting in front of microphones.] : Oh, I wasn't thinking nerdy womanizer. : I was thinking nerdy fuckboy. [Visual: A woman with long brown hair sits in an orange chair in front of a microphone, speaking.] : I think those words are synonymous. : That's not much better.", "max_char": 150}

{"language": "English", "text": "[Visual: A woman asks if the man is ready, then claims to be reading his mind; the man responds with 'Rock-Rock', and the woman says 'that was too obvious' after the man says 'Rock-Rock' again.] [Visual: A woman with long dark hair, wearing a black top, speaks into a microphone, asking, 'are you ready?'] : Are you ready? : I'm gonna start- Of course. : reading your mind now. [Visual: The woman with dark hair speaks into the microphone, saying, 'reading your mind'.] : Please. [Visual: The man in a white shirt smiles into the microphone, and asks 'please'.] [Visual: The woman in a black dress with a white trim looks to her left with a skeptical expression.] : Andrea, I need to know. [Visual: A woman with long brown hair smiles and says, 'any day now'.] : Yeah, ready? [Visual: The woman with long dark hair smiles and gestures with her hand, saying 'ready?'] : Rock- Rock. :  __missing Ah, I'm the rock guy. [Visual: The man speaks directly into the microphone, mentioning, 'I was a'.] : Yeah, okay, that was too obvious. [Visual: The woman speaks into the microphone and says, 'that was'.] : I'm gonna do rock again. [Visual: A man is sitting and talking into a microphone.] : Rock- Rock. [Visual: During a rock-paper-scissors game, the man claims he knew what the woman would choose, and that men don't lie, while the woman calls out 'Scissors' and they both say 'scissors shoot'.] : paper- Paper. : scissors shoot. : Shoot. [Visual: A split screen shows a man and a woman in conversation.] : I told you, I literally told you. : I knew you weren't gonna lie, but I didn't want to say which one. [Visual: A close up of a man talking into a microphone.] : Men don't lie. : Men never lie. : There's never been a guy in history who's lied. : For this one, don't tell me what you're gonna do. [Visual: A woman speaks into a microphone.] : Scissors. [Visual: A man is speaking into a microphone.] : Rock- Rock. : paper- Paper. [Visual: A split screen shows a man and a woman talking.] : scissors shoot.", "max_char": 150}

{"language": "English", "text": "[Visual: The podcast introduces Bobby Fischer's controversial views, including his disparaging comments on women and their chess abilities; Speaker mentions Fischer's negative opinions.] : So what I'm hearing is you love Bobby Fischer and you think his opinions about the Jews are all correct. : And on women. : He had some, some fun takes about how women are terrible at chess. [Visual: A woman is seen in profile at a podcast, with the text 'about how' visible at the bottom.] : Oh, they're terrible chess players. [Visual: The speakers sarcastically agree with the previous statements about women's chess abilities, making sexist remarks about women's place, while questioning the relevance of previous statements.] : They could beat anyone, even a queen down. : I don't know why. [Visual: A woman is seen in profile at a podcast, with the text 'even a' visible at the bottom.] : I guess they're just not so smart. [Visual: A close-up black and white shot of a young man, talking.] [Visual: A very close, slightly blurry, black and white shot of a young man, smiling.] : That they belong in the kitchen. [Visual: A woman is seen in profile at a podcast, with the text 'in the kitchen' visible at the bottom.] : No, they can't cook, but they stay in the house. [Visual: A close-up black and white shot of a young man, smiling.]", "max_char": 220}

{"language": "English", "text": "[Visual: Speaker states her desire to sculpt her upper glutes and clarifies what she means by this.] [Visual: A woman with long brown hair speaks into a microphone with a podcast logo visible.] [Visual: Speaker explains that the shape of the glutes may not change dramatically, but they can become more lean.] : I want upper booty. [Visual: Another Speaker questions whether her glutes will get smaller as a result of the workout.] : You know, like when you sculpt? [Visual: Speaker clarifies that she believes the speaker's glutes are already perfect and that she wants to sculpt them.] : I don't think your booty shape is gonna change. : What you have will get more lean. [Visual: A split screen shows two women each speaking into a microphone with a podcast logo visible.] : Wait, so you're telling me I'm gonna work out and my booty's gonna get smaller? [Visual: A woman with long brown hair speaks into a microphone with a podcast logo visible.] : I don't think you need a bigger booty. : I think yours is perfect. : I don't think I need a bigger booty. : I just want a sculpt.", "max_char": 220}
